analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha, so I have heard:

original: “Ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū sīlasampannā samādhisampannā paññāsampannā vimuttisampannā
analyzed: ye te bhikkhave bhikkhū sīla sampannā samādhi sampannā paññā sampannā vimutti sampannā

translated: perfected in the knowledge and vision of release, who are instructors, teachers, preceptors, transmitters of the Teacher’s message,1🔽who are well-versed in the teachings, who are able to explain the teachings, to make them clear, to define them, to reveal them, to explain them, to make them plain, who are able to teach the Dhamma—🔽I say that seeing those monks is of great benefit.

original: upasaṅkamanampahaṁ, bhikkhave, tesaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ bahūpakāraṁ vadāmi;🔽payirupāsanampahaṁ, bhikkhave, tesaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ bahūpakāraṁ vadāmi;

translated: I say that hearing those monks is of great benefit.🔽I say that approaching those monks is of great benefit.🔽I say that revering those monks is of great benefit.

original: anussaraṇampahaṁ, bhikkhave, tesaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ bahūpakāraṁ vadāmi;
analyzed: anussaraṇam paha bhikkhave tesam bhikkhūnam bahu upakāram vadāmi

original: anupabbajjampahaṁ, bhikkhave, tesaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ bahūpakāraṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: an upabbajjam paha bhikkhave tesam bhikkhūnam bahu upakāram vadāmi
translated: I say that it is very helpful for those monks to go forth.
And why is that?

original: Tathārūpe, bhikkhave, bhikkhū sevato bhajato payirupāsato aparipūropi sīlakkhandho
analyzed: tathārūpe bhikkhave bhikkhū sevataḥ bhajataḥ payirupāsataḥ a paripūraḥ api sīlakkhandhaḥ
translated: Because when you associate with, get to know, and attend upon such monks,🔽even if your virtue is not yet purified, it will be purified;

original: bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchati, aparipūropi samādhikkhandho bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchati,🔽aparipūropi paññākkhandho bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchati, aparipūropi vimuttikkhandho

translated: even if your concentration is not yet developed, it will be developed;🔽even if your wisdom is not yet matured, it will be matured;🔽even if your deliverance is not yet verified, it will be verified;

original: bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchati, aparipūropi vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandho bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchati.

translated: even if your knowledge and vision of deliverance is not yet developed, it will be developed.

The Lord Buddha spoke this verse with reference to this.
This is the meaning of this verse:
“This is the cause of joy for those who know,

analyzed: etam ha iti vijānata  yat idam

for the Noble Ones who live by the Dhamma.

they shine, they are the light-makers.🔽The wise ones are the light-makers,
the seers, the ones who have overcome the stain.
Having heard their teaching,
the wise ones, having understood it well,
having directly known the destruction of birth,

original: nāgacchanti punabbhavan”ti.🔽Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
